abstract: Andrew M. Cuomo, New York’s attorney general, took aim at Wall Street’s looming bonuses on Monday, sending letters to eight of the nation’s biggest banks demanding information on how they structured those payouts.
snippet: Andrew M. Cuomo, New York’s attorney general, took aim at Wall Street’s looming bonuses on Monday, sending letters to eight of the nation’s biggest banks demanding information on how they structured those payouts.
lead_paragraph: Update | 12:52 p.m. Andrew M. Cuomo, New York’s attorney general, took aim at Wall Street’s looming bonuses on Monday, sending letters to eight of the nation’s biggest banks demanding information on how they structured those payouts.

headline.main: Cuomo Demands Bonus Data From 8 Big Banks

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bank of New York Mellon Corp

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
